children: A 22-year-old woman is evaluated for fever, weight loss, and exertional dyspnea.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is Hodgkin lymphoma. Hodgkin lymphoma represents approximately 10% of lymphomas and is curable in most, but not all, patients. Presentation with mediastinal, cervical, and supraclavicular involvement is particularly common for the nodular sclerosing subtype. Patients may also present with B symptoms, although that is more commonly seen in elderly patients with more advanced disease. The diagnosis is established with a lymph node biopsy specimen showing Reed-Sternberg cells, malignant cells that originate from germinal center B cells and are seen in an inflammatory infiltrate. This patient has an anterior mediastinal mass as
that was diagnosed as Hodgkin lymphoma.

objective.__html: Diagnose Hodgkin lymphoma on chest radiography.
